greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Sum of the elements of the absolute difference table of the divisors of n.
comment: First differs from A273103 at a(14). - _Omar E. Pol_, May 15 2016
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: For n = 14 the divisors of 14 are 1, 2, 7, 14, and the absolute difference triangle of the divisors is
The sum of all elements of the triangle is 1 + 2 + 7 + 14 + 1 + 5 + 7 + 4 + 2 + 2 = 45, so a(14) = 45.
mathematica: Table[Total@ Flatten@ NestWhileList[Abs@ Differences@ # &, Divisors@ n, Length@ # > 1 &], {n, 56}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, May 18 2016 *)
results.author: _Omar E. Pol_, Aug 02 2011
ext: More terms from _Alois P. Heinz_, Aug 02 2011
